Relapsed Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
						                    Standard treatment of relapsed childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) that comes back in the bone marrow may include the following:         -  Combination chemotherapy.    -  Chemotherapy with or without total-body irradiation followed by a stem cell transplant, using stem cells from a donor.
